Establish what, if anything, to use as a gaze-contingent marker. Creates a OpenGL texture if so required (i.e., might alternatively just use the mouse cursor). If none, set obj.showFixations = false, and do nothing.

parameterdescription.para: none, cursor, or the name of an arbitrary image in ./resources/images/FixationTextures

memberdef.type: mlhsSubst< mlhsInnerSubst< matlabtypesubstitute, xy >,mlhsInnerSubst< matlabtypesubstitute, t > >
memberdef.definition: mlhsSubst< mlhsInnerSubst< matlabtypesubstitute, xy >,mlhsInnerSubst< matlabtypesubstitute, t > > ivis::eyetracker::IvDataInput::getLastKnownXY
memberdef.name: getLastKnownXY

briefdescription.para: Get the last reported xy gaze coordinate (and also the timestamp, if requested). Can optionally request the raw value, rather than the processed (e.g., smoothed, interpolated) value. Note that if NaNs are not allowed, and no non-data has yet been received, then xy==[-inf -inf], and t==-inf.

parameterdescription.para: optional. Whether to use the unprocessed coordinate (default = false)
optional. Whether to return only the last non-NaN gaze coordinates (default = false)

briefdescription.para: IvDataInput Constructor.

memberdef.argsstring: (matlabtypesubstitute x, matlabtypesubstitute y, matlabtypesubstitute t, matlabtypesubstitute v, matlabtypesubstitute p, matlabtypesubstitute logData)
memberdef.name: processData

briefdescription.para: Interpolate, smooth, log the data, update the GUI and any fixation marker.

detaileddescription.para: n.b. Overwrite this file in the subclass instantiation if you want to customise the way data are smoothed/ interpolated/ tagged/ etc.
n.b., input vectors must be columns

x
: x position (in pixels)
y
: y position (in pixels)
t
: timestamp (in seconds)
v
: some kind of validity measure
p
: pupil diameter
logData
saccadeOnTime
26/06/14
PRJ c : eye-event code (see IvEventCode)

briefdescription.para: Use linear interpolation to fill in small amounts of missing data, and then perform a running-mean filter.
Suppress any saccades that fall within a specified proximity to another saccade or a blink.
Draw gaze-contingent fixation marker at the specified coordinates. Do nothing if either xy == NaN.

detaileddescription.para:
xy
1x2 integer, containing xy eye-gaze coordinates (in pixels)
26/06/14
PRJ n.b., doesn't actually flip the screen

briefdescription.para: Convenience function to print text to a PTB OpenGL screen.
Generic data input class that must be instantiated by a subclass. Handles the crucial data processing task (applying calibration filtering, interpolating, classifying, sending data to logs, etc.).

detaileddescription.para: n.b. subclasses should NOT repeated the Singleton blurb (if want to be able to access generically, via DataInput.getSingleton()

IvDataInput Abstract Methods
connect - Establish a link to the eyetracking hardware.
reconnect - Disconnect and re-establish link to eyetracker.
refresh - Query the eyetracker for new data; process and store.
flush - Query the eyetracker for new data; discard.
readRawLog- Parse data stored in a .raw binary file (hardware-brand specific format).
validate - Validate initialisation parameters.
IvDataInput Methods
IvDataInput - Constructor.
setFixationMarker - Establish what, if anything, to use as a gaze-contingent marker.
updateDriftCorrection - Instruct IvCalibration to update the drift correction.
getLastKnownXY - Get the last reported xy gaze coordinate (and also the timestamp, if requested).
IvDataInput Static Methods:
validateSubclass - Check that the class name is valid, and that the parameter are congruent for this class.
init - Initialise parameters, create GUIS, etc.
readDataLog - Parse data stored in a .csv data file.
estimateLag - Estimate expected lag given a specified set of parameters.
